result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher J Pinnow is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

On one or more charges in this case, Christopher J Pinnow was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Christopher Pinnow present in court, in custody via video with attorney Brad Lochowicz. ADA Vivien TenHaken appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

State is in compliance with victims rights

WCS Representatives are present in court

Report received & reviewed by Defense counsel, he has not addressed with Deft however previous discussion with Deft is consistent with findings in report.

160 days credit toward release

ADA TenHaken agrees

Court orders conditional release, commitment of 22 1/2 years with the credit as stated
Court does not find that Deft is a danger to himself or others at this time

Court has colloquy with representatives from WCS

Court will sign orders

records.addlTxt: Order for Pre Disposition Investigation
BOND QUASHED

8:33am Court in session

Defendant Christopher Pinnow present in court, in custody with attorney Brad Lochowicz. ADA Andrew Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties have an agreement, Atty Lochowicz puts agreement on the record. 

State is in compliance with victims rights, victims are in agreement with resolution. 

Plea questionnaire filed with the Court by Atty Lochowicz.
Court has plea colloquy with Deft
Court gives warnings as to deportation, voting in eligibility, firearm restriction & body armor restriction & penalties if he violates, Deft acknowledges. 

Deft pleads guilty by mental disease/defect on Cts #1, #2 & #3

Parties are waiving jury trial, parties agree that the Dr's report supports the special plea.

Court finds factual basis exists, adjudges Deft guilty & adopts the agreement of the parties.

Cts #1, #2 & #3:

Civil Commitment for 22 1/2 years



Ct #4 is dismissed out right
Cts #5 & #6 are DRI

Traffic citations are dismissed also

Court will set review hearing, Dr.'s report to be submitted within 15 days. 

Nothing further from the parties

8:48am Court in recess
Review hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Subpoena - Dr. M.S. Day 3 trial, 9-14-2022

Defendant Christopher Pinnow present in court, in custody via video with attorney Keith Venema for attorney Brad Lochowicz. ADA Anderw Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Deft has demanded speedy. Parties are confirming for trial. Offer received, Deft is rejecting. State has 10 witnesses, all served & available. Court orders exclusion of witnesses subject to victim & court officer. Voir Dire-2 alternates, 5 strikes each. Jurors may take notes, questions to be addressed morning of trial. Atty Venema states Atty Lochowicz will arrange civilian clothing for Deft. State to e-file jury instructions the Friday before trial. State makes record that drug results have been received. Dr. to be subpoenaed for day 3. Citations will be tried to the Court.
Sheriff Process Fee, Jefferson Co #202200795, $75
Randomly reassigned:  Case will remain assigned to Judge Koss after August 1, 2022.
Defense

Defendant Christopher J Pinnow appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by Atty. James Sempf.  Attorney Leah Selmek in court for Christopher J Pinnow. Called @ 2:13 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for arraignment on22CF135 with citations tracking (22TR820, 22TR821, 22TR822).  Court addresses GF file, which appears to contain the same charges as 22CF135. Response by Atty. Sempf who agrees. GF file to be consolidated into the CF file. Record by Atty. Selmek who enters not guilty plea, reserves speedy, and asks for status in about 60 days. Court sets all matters as requested.
Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

records.addlTxt:
3:28 PM Defendant Christopher J Pinnow appeared by video. Attorney Selmek in court for and with Christopher Pinnow.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
State is requesting more time to file Complaint, waiting on report, may have more charges added.

Adj. 3:31 PM
Signed bond filed with the court.

BOND TO COVER 22GF276 & 22CF135
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH L.C. (dob 12-21-1980) OR C.P. (dob 12-30-2010). Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant. 

22-1110 thru 22-1114 & 22-1294
